item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Has Big Shoes to Fill as an RPG
item.description:
The announcement of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 surprised RPG fans earlier this year by bringing a new IP to the battle for RPG supremacy. But, with so many new RPGs on the horizon, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has some huge competition to contend with, upping the stakes for its success.

In its debut game, Sandfall Interactive has created an experience unlike anything RPG fans are used to. Set in a Belle Epoque-inspired world in the midst of destruction, players will join the ranks of the titular Expedition 33 as they attempt to save their world from a mysterious evil. In the reveal trailer for Expedition 33 , fans were introduced to stunning visuals of a world that looks frozen on the brink of collapse, as well as the Paintress, a creature who causes mass deaths simply by painting. Though the premise and art style both stand out from the crowd, the game will ultimately be judged by its gameplay, which likewise has taken a familiar concept and twisted it to create something new. With a release window of 2025, Expedition 33 has plenty of competition, so it may struggle to stand out among fan-favorite franchises.

Expedition 33 is Competing with Heavy Hitters

In the relatively short time since its announcement, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has already generated some buzz, which is a good sign that it has the attention of RPG fans. But, slated for a 2025 release date, that puts it in competition with some highly anticipated RPGs in existing franchises. Both new games, like Avowed , a new entry in the Like a Dragon series, and the remaster of Suikoden 1 and 2 , already have fans eagerly awaiting them, which raises questions about whether there will be room in the RPG landscape for Expedition 33 to thrive.

The good news for Expedition 33 is that it’s already drawing comparisons to highly successful games of the past. Sandfall has stated that it was heavily influenced by the Persona and Final Fantasy series, so players may draw some parallels to their old favorites in the new title. In particular, with its battle system and voice cast, Expedition 33 has been compared to Final Fantasy 16 , potentially bridging a gap for fans of both the classic and newer systems of that franchise. Bringing the old and new together is something that may help Expedition 33 make a name for itself. However, the true draw of the game may be in its combat, as it paves a new path in the RPG landscape.

Expedition 33’s Combat May Set It Apart

The best games put gameplay first, above their plot, their soundtrack, or even their art style. So, while Expedition 33 looks promising, it can only be judged by what players feel when they jump into battle. Unfortunately, at this time there aren’t any hands-on accounts of the game, but a look into the combat system does hold clues as to what players might expect. The draw of Expedition 33 ’s combat is its blending of familiar RPG staples.

The game is set to use both turn-based and real-time systems, giving players an experience that few other games offer. From what’s been presented, it looks like battles will take on two different phases as they progress. It appears that players will have a turn-based style selection of their attacks and defenses, but after the selection, an action-style input system will determine the effectiveness of their moves. This unique take on a turn-based battle system ensures that fans of both types of gameplay can enjoy the experience, rather than catering to just one group of RPG fans.

Sandfall Interactive describes the combat in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , saying "Open an active dimension in combat- dodge, parry, and counter in real time, chain combos by mastering attack rhythms, and target enemy weakpoints using a free-aim system."

The beauty of this type of combat system is that it will likely feel both familiar and distinct, setting Expedition 33 apart from the myriad of other RPGs set to come out in the same timeframe. In this way, Expedition 33 offers the best of both worlds for RPG fans. The year ahead is stacked with competition, but with its beautiful graphics and stand-out game systems, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 looks set to deliver fans something that they will be talking about long after the game is over.

item.title: 10 Best Horror Games Without Weapons
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The best horror games create powerful feelings of helplessness for players by stripping them of weapons and defenses.
  • The scariest horror games portray players as the hunted, not the hunter, facing overwhelming odds.
  • Helplessness in horror games is achieved through making players completely defenseless with no weapons or combat options.

Good horror games excel at making players feel helpless. While most action titles and RPGs let players empower themselves with weapons and special abilities, horror games go the opposite direction, casting the protagonist in a truly hopeless situation and forcing them to struggle to survive and find a way out.

One of the easiest ways to accomplish this hopeless feeling is by making the player completely defenseless. Some of the scariest horror games don't have any weapons, or any sort of combat at all. The protagonist is left entirely at the mercy of the terrifying forces trying to end them, and the player must struggle to survive the onslaught without any way to fight back. Here are some of the best horror games without weapons.

10 Five Nights At Freddy's

A Week Of Woe

The original Five Nights At Freddy's is a game that needs no introduction. This indie darling exploded in popularity thanks to its simple but unique premise and the haunting designs of its terrifying animatronics. The title has since spawned a massive multimedia franchise encompassing several games and even a major motion picture.

One of the reasons the game works so well is the sheer helplessness of the player character. The doors of the protagonist's tiny office provide only a weak, temporary defense against the lumbering animatronics, and players must carefully keep tabs on the whole restaurant in order to stay alive. With no real way to fight back against these horrible machines, the player is a sitting duck for five harrowing nights.

9 I'm On Observation Duty

Anomaly Hunting

Platforms

PC, macOS, Linux, iOS

Released

December 14, 2018

Developer

Notovia

Genre

Horror, Puzzle

I'm On Observation Duty is a bite-sized horror experience which has spawned a respectable series of sequels, all based around the same hair-raising premise. In I'm On Observation Duty , players take on the role of a surveillance operator who must scrutinize a mysterious house through a series of security cameras. The only way to survive is to catch supernatural phenomena as they happen and report them on the spot.

This simple but high-stakes gameplay loop leads to high tension and paranoia spiking intensely over the course of the game's brief playtime. Fans who want to experience more tension can turn to the game's many sequels, but the first game alone will make for a solid evening of pure terror.

8 The Mortuary Assistant

Doomed Among The Dead

Even among other games in the horror genre, The Mortuary Assistant is a particularly macabre experience. As the name suggests, the player character is caught working in a mortuary late at night when they are attacked by a horrifying demonic entity. The player must struggle to stay alive while finding out how to banish the demon before it's too late.

While the game is rather short, a robust randomization element keeps its replayability high. Different hauntings and spectral events will occur on each playthrough, preventing the game from growing predictable or stale. Each and every visit to the mortuary will provide uniquely terrifying demonic encounters, which the player is all but helpless to resist.

7 Doki Doki Literature Club

Appearances Can Be Deceiving

The shocking twist at the heart of Doki Doki Literature Club is the stuff of legends now, but when it launched, it took the gaming world completely by surprise. This gripping psychological horror game hides its deeply disturbing content behind a seemingly innocent visual novel about romance and poetry, only to lure fans into the true horror lurking beneath.

Doki Doki Literature Club delivers on some surprisingly deep and heavy themes about the nature of relationships and even the constraints of the video game genre itself. There is no combat in the game, and not even any enemies in the traditional sense, but Doki Doki Literature Club will likely still have fans on the edge of their seat from the first reveal of its true nature all the way to the end.

6 Iron Lung

The Unimaginable Depths

The horror genre's continued attempts to frighten players in new and unexpected ways have led to some truly imaginative games, and Iron Lung is one of the strangest. This game casts the player as a prisoner on an alien moon adrift in an ocean of blood, sealed into a tiny, windowless submarine and forced to explore the stygian depths.

The protagonist's only means of interacting with the outside world is a slow, old-fashioned camera that will give them brief, time-delayed snapshots of the deep waters outside. These blind flashes of insight into an otherwise incomprehensible sea, coupled with the intense claustrophobia of the player's tiny submarine, make for a sense of helplessness and dread that is almost unparalleled in the genre.

5 Immortality

The Mystery Of Marissa Marcel

Immortality may stretch the definition of what a video game is, but it's still a remarkably creative horror experience that fans of the genre won't want to miss. The game is presented as a collection of archival footage from three unfinished films, all starring a mysteriously disappeared actress named Marissa Marcel. By browsing through the footage, players can attempt to piece together what happened to her, but it swiftly becomes apparent that there's something much darker going on beneath the surface.

The secrets of Immortality are much better experienced than summarized, but they take the game to some truly unnerving places. This is far from a conventional horror video game, but it will lead to just as many sleepless nights by the time the mystery is solved.

4 Phasmophobia

Ghost Hunting With Friends

Phasmophobia exploded in popularity in late 2020, when it served as a seasonally-appropriate way to get scared with friends online. This game casts up to four players as professional ghost hunters, traveling to haunted locales and collecting spectral evidence in order to identify a ghost before it murders them.

Players can subdue and ward away the game's hostile spirits through various means, but they can't fight back against them directly. Typically, if a player sees a phantom face to face, it's already too late. Players must proceed carefully and contend with faulty equipment and meddlesome spirits in order to stay alive and earn their keep.

3 Amnesia: The Dark Descent

The Depths Of Madness

Amnesia: The Dark Descent is, in many ways, the gold standard for helplessness in horror gaming. This survival horror game casts players as a man without his memories lost in a dark and crumbling castle, infested with horrors beyond comprehension. At no point does the game offer the player any concrete way to fight back against these abominations, forcing them to rely on stealth and evasion if they want to stay alive.

The oppressive atmosphere of madness and dread that pervades every second of Amnesia has made it an icon in the horror genre, and provided the blueprint for several sequels. For all the dread these later games have caused, Amnesia: The Dark Descent remains one of the most iconic survival horror games out there.

2 SOMA

A Nautical Nightmare

This nightmarish game, from the creators of Amnesia : The Dark Descent , transports players to a derelict research station at the very bottom of the ocean. This terrifying facility is populated by shambling robotic horrors and hideously mutated humans and fish. The protagonist, Simon, must learn how he got there and how to escape before he is slaughtered by the game's horrifying, unstoppable killing machines.

Much like its sibling game Amnesia , SOMA spirals swiftly into despair and dread as players learn how the facility came to be destroyed and how Simon ended up there. This game deals with dark and tragic themes concerning the fate of the human race and the nature of digitized consciousness, and its philosophical implications are almost as troubling as the horrors that stalk its waterlogged halls.

1 P.T.

A Lost Legend

The infamous P.T. is the stuff of video game legend, both because of how deeply, incredibly frightening it is, and because it's lost to modern gaming forever. This brief game served to set the stage for an upcoming entry in the Silent Hill franchise, created by the illustrious Hideo Kojima, but unfortunately, the game was canceled, and the playable demo was removed from stores.

When it was available, P.T. was a revolutionary title. It trapped players in an endlessly repeating hallway, looping back on itself over and over again while players evaded the attention of a malevolent spirit and puzzled over deeply sinister environmental clues to sort out the game's dark past. Silent Hills could have been a truly unforgettable game, but fans lucky enough to play P.T. were still able to experience the hopeless feeling of being trapped forever in a madman's nightmare.

item.title: When Games Turn Into Movie Scenes #20
item.description: Some crazy car chases in Just Cause and Grand Theft Auto, as well as other cinematic clips.

item.title: Rumor: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases New Details About Sunday
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A new Honkai: Star Rail leak is teasing more details about rumored character Sunday's in-game animations, hinting at the use of thorns within his graphics.
  • Sunday has seen numerous rumors about his eventual playability in the HoYoverse sci-fi RPG, suggested to be receiving a full visual overhaul for his playable version.
  • Leaks have also hinted at Sunday's gameplay, teasing his Element, Path, and a unique mechanic absorbing excess Energy from his allies.

A new leak from Honkai: Star Rail could potentially be teasing more details about rumored upcoming character Sunday's in-game animations, said to feature thorns within his graphics. The HoYoverse sci-fi RPG's most recent world has been filled with a plethora of the game's most highly-anticipated characters, with many seeing massive success following their launch. Firefly and Acheron have cemented their places as some of the game's most powerful DPS units, while others like Sparkle and Robin have seen universal popularity in support roles. However, one Penacony character is still waiting for their time in the spotlight.

Sunday has been one of the most heavily rumored members of Honkai: Star Rail 's Penacony cast, first appearing early on within the world's main story. Though Sunday plays a major role within the story of Penacony, even appearing as an in-game boss within the world, HoYoverse has yet to officially confirm the Oak Family leader's release. Sunday has seen numerous rumors and leaks related to his eventual playability, teasing everything from a major re-design to elements of his kit. Now, a new part of Sunday's playable version is being teased.

Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases Sunday Animations

A recent leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Ubatcha is hinting at some potential design elements for Sunday's playable release. The leak shares new graphical elements discovered in the game's files connected to "thorns," with previous leaks suggesting that Sunday's animations would heavily involve thorns. Thorns are already a prominent element within Sunday's initial appearance, featuring thorned patterns on both his jacket and within his halo. HoYoverse has yet to officially confirm an in-game playable debut for Sunday.

Speculation has run rampant about Sunday since his first appearance within Honkai: Star Rail , seeing a plethora of leaks about his full release. Leaks have suggested that Sunday will follow the Path of Harmony within Honkai: Star Rail , also believed to be an Imaginary element character. Previous information has also given brief hints about Sunday's gameplay and kit, hinting at a new mechanic allowing him to collect excess Energy generated by his allies. Sunday is currently believed to be releasing during the Version 2.7 update, expected to launch in December.

Sunday has been far from the only character to see leaks about his upcoming playability with several other Honkai: Star Rail cast members being teased. Previous rumors have hinted at multiple future roster additions, including rumored new character Aglaea and a new form of Tingyun among others. One of Honkai: Star Rail 's starter characters has also been the subject of recent rumors, suggesting that Herta may soon be receiving her own five-star variant. Honkai: Star Rail 's future patches look to have loads of highly-anticipated characters on the way in the near future.

item.title: Forza Horizon 4: 14 Best Cars for Drifting
item.description:
There are many missions, activities, and stunts to play around with when zipping across Forza Horizon 4 's lush English locales. From fast Street Races to Barn Finds to intense online battles, this dynamic open-world racer has no shortage of things to do. While fans enjoy the diverse features and events, mastering the art of the drift isn't often high on the list. Given their delicate and wild nature, pulling off lengthy drifts isn't always easy.

Thankfully, there are several cars whose traits and statistics accommodate this exhilarating feat. Solid handling, torque, and acceleration can all contribute to a ride ideal for coasting through turns and skidding across terrain for an extended time. Whether the goal is conquering pesky Drift Zones or exploiting the drift to pile on skill points, these are some of the best.

Updated September 27, 2024 by Stephen LaGioia: While Forza Horizon 4 has winded down in terms of popularity and content, the game has retrained some traffic thanks to a wealth of post-game content and alluring online gameplay. The latter particularly offers fun evergreen content that never seems to get old — the zombie-themed Infected and Battle Royale epic Eliminator, for instance.

With gamers returning to the lush locales of Britain for chaotic skirmishes like those mentioned — or just looking to unlock more goodies, picking a great drifting car is crucial. So we decided to revisit and juice up this list of the best cars for long and stylish drifts.

15

On Drift Zones In Forza Horizon 4

Several Drift Zones are scattered around the diverse regions of Great Britain, many of which feature hilly, windy, and/or treacherous roads and paths. Racking up decent skill points while keeping within the usually slim boundaries can be a tricky task, let alone achieving the three-star score each one offers.

Thus, having cars that excel at drifting while maintaining a fairly even keel should be the goal here. These cars usually include lightweight, rear-wheel driving cars with thick tires that can handle rough terrain. Though good handling, braking, as well as launch (to maintain some momentum and speed) are useful too.

14 Nissan Silvia K's Aero

25,000 Credits At The Autoshow

It should be fairly telling that the car's official description begins - "if you drift what you drive, this S14 Kouki model is your dream car in the making."

Indeed, this Japanese ride from the '90s is a great, low-cost option to refine and exploit those drifts, costing just 25,000 CR at the Autoshow. While more humble in appearance, the vehicle gets the job done on or off-road, with a solid launch ability and decent speed as well. It's not going to blow one's hair back, but it's a good starter car, particularly for drifting and skill points.

13 Hoonigan Mazda RX-7 FC "Twerkstallion"

50,000 CR At The Autoshow

Powered by a 5.3L turbocharged V8 engine, this 1992 race car enables extended drifts with ease — much like its lengthy name. This ride yields excellent weight distribution and is lightweight; great for coasting on off-road paths. It also comes with particularly solid, thick tires that can handle much that lies in its path.

Essentially, with its uniquely solid and light build, the Mazda RX-7 FC has been designed for drifting — though it also thrives when it comes to sheer speed on the road.

12 Chevrolet Corvette ZR1 (2019)

255,000 CR At The Autoshow (Requires The Car Pass Pack)

Those who invest in the Car Pass Pack will want to take this sleek and smooth ride for a spin. The ZR1 is pretty much stellar across the board statistically, with acceleration being its only (relative) weak point — a trait that's more secondary when it comes to drifting.

The car is laced with a 6.2L supercharged V8 engine and sports 755 BHP (brake horsepower) , making it a beast on the road or off. With rear-wheel drive, a rear wing, and an emphasis on torque, this car yields effective drifts in many scenarios. It can also reach a top speed of 215 mph without much of a sweat, hitting 60 mph in just 3 seconds.

11 BMW M3-GTR (2002)

Not At Autoshow - Horizon Backstage Pass, Forzathon Shop, Or Festival Playlist Reward

This acronym-heavy car from Germany shines as one of the rarest in the game — though drivers who favor drifting will find it worth seeking out. The ride is a potent variant of the more typical M3 GTR race car, laced with racing-focused modifications including a four-liter V8 engine.

This BMW can really hit the ground running, allowing players to resituate and bounce back quickly if their drifting gets out of control. Launching and, to a lesser extent, handling is where this car excels, which is a great combination for fast, controlled drifts.

10 Mazda MX-5 Miata (1994)

25,000 CR At The Autoshow

It's not one of the most juiced-up or glamorous cars, but this '94 production car from Japan is a great choice when it comes to Drift Zones. Its speed isn't going to be sky-high, but solid drifting doesn't necessarily require swiftness.

Slower cars like this can benefit with cleaner, more controllable drifts, provided the main goal isn't racking up major skill points. The car's lightweight and decent handling will allow for drifting that can be easily managed. It's a great beginner's car for those looking to hone their drift game. Sometimes slow and steady wins the race, after all.

9 Vauxhall Lotus Carlton

70,000 CR At The Autoshow

This speedy sports sedan excels when it comes to wild, extended drifting. As it happens, the Lotus Carlton had been the fastest sedan in the world since its 1990 debut.

Its launch and speed stats of 7.6 and 7.2 respectively ensure that players can quickly and easily skid around while notching ample skill points. At the same time, its steering and suspension allow for plenty of stability and feedback while whipping around sharp turns.

8 Toyota Supra RZ

250,000 CR At The Autoshow

This RWD sports car rides the line nicely between luxury and performance. It boasts ample horsepower and fairly easy handling on or off-road. Its potent-yet-efficient engine allows for a ride that's swift and steady.

Its above-average speed and launch stats will enable drivers to get flying through those Drift Zones quite quickly. It can also help them rattle off many skill points.

7 Nissan Fairlady Z 432

150,000 CR At The Autoshow

The car holds a distinct East-meets-West feel, as Japanese manufacturer Nissan intended this to sell to the American market. The rare, retro-style sports car isn't exactly going to burn rubber, but it should work wonders for drift enthusiasts and those who favor turn-laden tracks.

Its stats are pretty well-rounded, making for a drive that's smooth and manageable. Players should also note that the newer models of the Fairlady (350Z/370Z) also excel when it comes to drifting.

6 Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG

60,000 CR At The Autoshow

This 2010 sports car from Germany shines for its solid handling and powerful V8 engine, which sets the stage for swift and flashy drifting. Its stats are above average across the board (for the potent S1 827 build).

This car's 8.8 launch and 7.8 braking allow drivers to stop and go with relative ease. It is an ideal trait for drifting around tight corners and winding roads.

5 BMW M6 Coupe (Forza Edition)

Not At Autoshow - Rewarded From Wheelspin, Forzathon Shop, Or Festival Playlist

The default model of this car is admirable in its own right, but the Forza Edition really has it going on. This luxury car can only be obtained as a Wheelspin or Super Wheelspin reward, or through an Auction House listing.

Its top-notch acceleration and handling allow it to zip across twists and turns quickly and efficiently, making it a great choice for Drift Zones. On top of this, the Forza Edition provides a Drift Skills boost that can be exploited for even more points.

4 Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat

75,000 CR At The Autoshow

This sleek muscle car from 2015 can really get the job done on multiple fronts for its respectable asking price of 75,000 CR. Its 8.1 speed stat and 7.5 launch (A 776) will allow drivers to get those extended drifts going rather quickly.

Its unique composition also gives it added torque , which aids in more prominent drifts. Add this to its potent horsepower and thick tires, and drivers can easily rock stellar drifts in this car.

3 Shelby Monaco King Cobra

550,000 CR At Autoshow (Requires Barrett-Jackson Car Pack)

Race cars tend to be safe bets when it comes to good drifting cars, and this especially holds true for classic models like this. The nimble, lightweight nature of this US-made car makes it optimal for coasting around the many twists and turns throughout England.

It's not going to knock any socks off in terms of horsepower. However, its solid launch and handling make it a good choice for skidding around corners swiftly while keeping control.

2 Hoonigan Ford "Hoonicorn" Mustang

500,000 CR At The Autoshow

This Ford "Hoonicorn" Mustang is a fan favorite when it comes to online races and competitions, and there's a good reason for this. Quick, solid, and versatile, this car can handle almost anything thrown its way, and that includes ample drifting.

The vehicle is even tagged as a "drift car," making its specialty rather apparent. The powerful engine of this all-wheel-drive car sets the stage for sustained skidding, especially while offroading. Its notable torque, coupled with awesome stats across the board, allows for drifts that are both flashy and manageable.

1 Formula Drift #43 Dodge Viper SRT10

300,000 CR At The Autoshow (Requires Formula Drift Car Pack)

It makes sense that a car bearing the "drift" tag would excel at the thrilling feat in question, and this Viper doesn't disappoint. A standout of the Formula Drift Car Pack, the vehicle impresses with its twin-turbocharged V10 engine, as well as its superb launch and handling.

These traits, coupled with some great braking , make it ideal to blaze through Drift Zones effectively. Players will enjoy having this Viper fittingly whip and slither around the winding roads and rugged terrain.
